cd06a86e-c050-4275-acd4-5d03ae3695c8.description: Students who earn this credential have proven their understanding of building applications using JavaScript. They are able to design programs which achieve outcomes requiring conditional logic, functional decomposition, modular design, and code clarity. Programs that the student has completed include command-line and web based applications. The student was able to achieve all requirements included in the project assessment, and also met the expectations for program design and organization.
cd06a86e-c050-4275-acd4-5d03ae3695c8.name: JavaScript Development Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 100 hours of classroom instruction covering the foundations of programming and web development using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML.
Designed and built multiple command-line based applications which interface with a human user via natural language to control the flow of a complex program.

Created a complex web application using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to allow for the display of interactive elements and the handling of user input via asynchronous events. Control for the interactions a human could initiate, and use those interactions to drive the logic of the application.

76edd3e1-acf8-4f94-9050-8a2c90949279.description: Students who earn this credential have constructed back-end applications using Express, MongoDB, and Mongoose. They have created server-side solutions to challenges which include building JSON API servers which follow the REST architecture pattern, while retrieving and persisting data from the MongoDB database. The solutions model their data using document based relationships, and map these relationships to JavaScript objects using the Mongoose library.
76edd3e1-acf8-4f94-9050-8a2c90949279.name: Express MongoDB Back-end Development

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 50 hours of classroom instruction covering the creation of back-end APIs using the Express JavaScript library to construct web servers and deliver JSON to client-side applications. The student has demonstrated the ability model object relationships as documents within the MongoDB database and to interface with MongoDB using the Mongoose library to construct schemas.

Constructed back-end web applications that required competence in building the server-side of the web development stack, including serving data to client-side React applications, generating API routes with Express, and database persistence using MongoDB and Mongoose. The application logic was complex, and required the student to demonstrate their ability to build modular solutions at various levels of abstraction.

4ac12bf2-125c-44dd-a06b-53eb21e87c54.description: Students who earn this credential have demonstrated competence in the construction of full-stack applications at a level consistent with a junior software developer. The student has completed multiple projects of varying complexity, including a capstone project consisting of a four-week group software development effort with a real-world client. Students are capable of driving a feature to completion at any level of the stack, and are comfortable with finding solutions to novel problems.
4ac12bf2-125c-44dd-a06b-53eb21e87c54.name: Full-Stack JavaScript Software Development Bootcamp Completion

badge_template_activities.title: Completed over 200 hours of classroom instruction covering the fundamentals of programming, web design with HTML and CSS, construction of web applications with vanilla JavaScript, component driven front-end development using the React library, back-end server development using Express, and persistence using MongoDB and Mongoose.

Completion of a group capstone project which provided a solution to a real-world problem proposed by a sponsoring individual or organization. The capstone project solution was substantial, and required four weeks of work to complete alongside the project sponsor.
Completion of the career track, consisting of lessons covering job search strategies, networking, LinkedIn profile optimization, portfolio creation, as well as technical and behavioral interviewing.

151ee6b2-78cd-4873-8508-666d310e7b9d.description: Students who earn this credential have constructed front-end applications using the React library. They have designed component oriented solutions to programming challenges which test their understanding in utilizing advanced libraries, retrieving data from APIs, using JSON, conditionally rendering components based on business logic, and managing application state.
151ee6b2-78cd-4873-8508-666d310e7b9d.name: React Front-end Development

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 50 hours of classroom instruction covering the React front-end library, fetching data using native browser methods and third-party packages, processing JSON, conditional rendering, and application state management.

Constructed a complex web application which utilized the React JavaScript library, in combination with a third party JSON API. The learner was able to meet all project expectations and utilized their understanding and skill to build a modular, component based solution that build upon their prior understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript foundations.

Designed and constructed a personal portfolio site which utilized the React JavaScript library in addition to HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Hosted the portfolio online using one of several service providers.

59381dfd-7be3-4f39-b48e-c6db68a86c34.description: Students with this credential have developed their understanding of user-experience research through the completion of labs, exercises, and interactions with users representative of a product or service audience. They can demonstrate competency in the various practices of a user research project and understand how each practice informs the larger design solution. Students additionally understand how to source participants, conduct a user survey, analyze findings and present them to stakeholders.
59381dfd-7be3-4f39-b48e-c6db68a86c34.name: UX Research

badge_template_activities.title: Completed course curriculum covering the fundamentals of user-experience research, sourcing participants, designing user surveys, analyzing survey results, task-based testing, and reporting findings to stakeholders.

Completion of user research design labs, exercises, challenges, and practice with real-world participants in a user research setting. Students apply empathy and their contextual understanding of a process, product, or service to design research questions and tasks such that gaps in users’ needs or understanding are identified and communicated.

Completion of journey mapping, user story generation, and flow diagramming challenges require the student to document the specific interactions a user will experience and arrange those experiences within the context of the user's needs as determined by interviews and activities.

ebdb9c31-84a8-4912-8fd8-b5b9b2599894.description: Students who earn this credential have proven their understanding of user-experience design through the completion of lectures, assignments, and various labs/activities. They are able to communicate the various components of a user-experience project, and how each of the practices inter-relate such that a successful design solution is delivered at the conclusion of the process. Students additionally understand relationships between information architecture, usability, and accessibility.
ebdb9c31-84a8-4912-8fd8-b5b9b2599894.name: UX/UI Bootcamp Completion

badge_template_activities.title: Completed over 200 hours of classroom instruction covering the fundamentals of user-experience and user-interface design, information architecture, design thinking, quantitative and qualitative research, conducting user surveys and interviews, task-based testing, journey mapping, user scenarios, wireframing, prototyping, mockups, interaction design, making design decisions based on evidence, implementing feedback, and presenting results to stakeholders.

Completion of a group capstone project which provided a design based solution to a real-world problem proposed by a sponsoring individual or organization. The capstone project solution was substantial and required eight weeks of work to complete alongside the project sponsor. Students presented the solution to the project sponsor and a live audience during a demonstration event.

Completion of the career track, consisting of lessons covering job search strategies, networking, LinkedIn profile optimization, design portfolio creation, as well as portfolio defense and behavioral interviewing.

bb9ef3ad-9dc8-489f-9dbb-a2f237397449.description: Students who earn this credential have proven their understanding of user-experience and interface design through the completion of lectures, assignments, and various activities. They are able to communicate the various components of a user-experience project, and how each of the practices inter-relate such that a successful design solution is delivered at the conclusion of the process. Students additionally understand relationships between information architecture, usability, and accessibility.
bb9ef3ad-9dc8-489f-9dbb-a2f237397449.name: UX/UI Design Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 100 hours of classroom instruction covering the fundamentals of user-experience and interface design, information architecture, design thinking, defining product requirements, information architecture, usability, accessibility, participatory design, discovery workshops, and task-based testing.
Completion of accessibility, empathy mapping, and user personas challenges that require the student to understand the perspective of the end-user of a product or service at a deep level.

Completion of journey mapping, user story generation, and flow diagramming challenges that require the student to document the specific interactions a user will experience and arrange those experiences within the context of the user's needs as determined by interviews and activities.

4ab81e94-20d9-4c9d-a249-40b219148aea.description: Students with this credential have proven their understanding of user-experience/interface design through the completion of labs and lectures with users representative of a product or service audience. They can demonstrate competency in the designing of digital and paper wireframes, prototypes, and style guides within Figma. Students understand the principles of prototyping to engage with clients in an effective manner while engaging in the design process.
4ab81e94-20d9-4c9d-a249-40b219148aea.name: UX/UI Interface Design

badge_template_activities.title: Completed course curriculum covering deliverables, design thinking, and defining product requirements aspects of user experience. To complete the curriculum, students dove into the user interface topics of interface elements, sketching, wireframing, typography, color theory, and prototyping to design effective products for project requirements and for a capstone project.

Completion of user interface design labs, exercises, challenges, and practice with real-world participants and tasks. Students apply skills learned and their contextual understanding of design thinking to create products that demonstrate their understanding of the client’s needs.
Completion of sketching, wireframing, color theory, typography, interface elements, style guide creation, and prototyping labs/activities to design effective and visually-appealing products.

6eebaa48-fe09-48eb-8fbf-229da7ecba76.description: Students who earn this credential have proven their comprehensive understanding of the tech sales field including knowledge in market research, engagement and sales strategies, social selling, consultative selling, discovery sales calls, sales pitches, handling objections, call and pitch follow up, and the tools and technology used in the industry through the completion of lectures, assignments, and various activities.
6eebaa48-fe09-48eb-8fbf-229da7ecba76.name: Tech Sales Bootcamp Completion

badge_template_activities.title: Completed course curriculum covering sales research, engagement strategies, market and sales strategies, social and consultative selling, sales calls and pitches, objections and rejections, follow up and handoffs, and sales tools and technology.

Completion of a capstone project which provided a competitive analysis, sales strategy, and pitch template solution to a real-world tech sales product or service sponsored by a tech company. The capstone project solution was substantial and required extensive work to complete alongside the project sponsor. Students presented the solution to the project sponsor.

f08bd010-a4e8-4495-8d9f-f151339185df.description: Students who earn this credential have proven their understanding of selling using consultative and social methods through the completion of lectures, assignments, and various activities. They understand the key principles of social selling and consultative selling including strong branding and network engagement, and customer questioning and problem-solving.
f08bd010-a4e8-4495-8d9f-f151339185df.name: Tech Sales: Consultative and Social Selling

badge_template_activities.title: Completed course curriculum covering methods of social selling, the best practices for using social media and digital content, consultative selling, negotiations, and value based selling.
Completion of LinkedIn and Social challenges that require the student to understand how to build meaningful profiles in order to successfully use social tools in selling.

7d00c371-e30e-47c1-8653-f211e0507da8.description: Students who earn this credential have proven their understanding of market and competitive research data collection and analysis, engagement strategies, market planning, and sales strategizing through the completion of lectures, assignments, and various activities. They are able to complete qualitative and quantitative research, competitive and market research, and research data analysis.
7d00c371-e30e-47c1-8653-f211e0507da8.name: Tech Sales: Prospecting and Pipeline Development

badge_template_activities.title: Completed course curriculum covering market and competitive research, ideal customer profile (ICP), research tools including databases, social media, sales outreach, and firmographics, and qualitative and quantitative research data.
Completion of ICP, and data collection challenges that require the student to understand the proper steps and tools for completing research.

cfa5ce4e-56ba-45a1-99b3-ba8c19b56a60.description: Students who earn this credential have proven their understanding of qualifying sales calls and buyer opportunities, preparing and strategizing for discovery calls, the best practices for using the ACE model for calls, and handling objections and rejections during sales calls and pitches through the completion of lectures, assignments, and various activities.
cfa5ce4e-56ba-45a1-99b3-ba8c19b56a60.name: Tech Sales: Qualification and Objection

badge_template_activities.title: Completed course curriculum covering methods of call qualifcation, call preparation, opening, diagnosing, and prescribing solutions during calls, closing class with call to actions, objections and rejections, and follow up and handoffs.
Completion of ACE checklist, call qualification, and follow-up challenges that require the student to understand how to properly conduct a sales discovery call and sales pitch call.

b1d66392-0d39-47dd-91c7-2b9013ab60dd.description: Students who earn this credential have proven their understanding of the fundamentals of sales through the completion of lectures, assignments, and various activities. They are able to communicate the various components of developing a pipeline, how to deal with rejection, time manage their sales schedules, and managing quota stress and fear.
b1d66392-0d39-47dd-91c7-2b9013ab60dd.name: Tech Sales: Sales Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Completed course curriculum covering the fundamentals of tech sales, pipeline development, objection and follow ups, time management, quota stress and fear, and evaluations.
Completion of ownership, subscription, and usage challenges that require the student to understand varying business models and the sales practices for each.

9eceb8b5-7e30-4b56-86b5-e0bda6047461.description: Students with this credential have developed their understanding of usability and accessibility through the completion of labs, exercises, and interactions with users representative of a product or service audience. They can demonstrate competency in the various practices of usability and understand how to develop responsive and adaptive design in accordance with accessibility. Students have a comprehensive understanding of usability heuristics and user experience writing.
9eceb8b5-7e30-4b56-86b5-e0bda6047461.name: UX/UI Design: Usability

badge_template_activities.title: Completed course curriculum covering improving the user experience through responsive and adaptive design, usability heuristics, heuristics evaluations, and ux writing.

Completion of responsive portfolio design and heuristic evaluation labs, exercises, and challenges. Students apply design best practices and their comprehensive understanding of the fundamentals of responsive and adaptive design to create designs that are comprehensive, straightforward, and user-friendly.

Completion of responsive design, heuristic evaluation, and ux writing challenges require the student to complete portfolio project tasts to incorporate usability, accessibility, responsive, and adaptive design elements and interfaces.
